snippet: Two cases this term — involving neutrality agreements with employers and the requirement that home care workers pay fees to unions — could produce significant rulings.
abstract: Labor leaders and businesses are closely watching Supreme Court case to be argued involving popular strategy used by unions of employing so-called neutrality agreements to successfully organize hundreds of thousands of workers; outcome in case could be most significant labor ruling in generation; court will also rule in case of home-care worker who says state of Illinois violated her First Amendment rights by requiring her to pay 'fair share' fees, to union she did not support.
lead_paragraph: Two cases this term — involving neutrality agreements with employers and the requirement that home care workers pay fees to unions — could produce significant rulings.

headline.main: Supreme Court to Take Up Challenges to Union Practices
headline.print_headline: High Court To Weigh Union Cases
